ir.taghizadeh.tehran.dependencies.database

Class DatabaseImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ir.taghizadeh.tehran.dependencies.database.DatabaseImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Database

    public class DatabaseImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Database

    DatabaseImpl

    The main logic about Firebase realtime database is done here and we can have access to these methods with Database interface which is injected into DatabaseModuleActivity.

    Since:
    2019-01-06
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ali Taghizadeh Gevari

    • Method Detail

      • pushComment

        public void pushComment(Comments comments,
                        java.lang.String dbLocation,
                        java.lang.String key)
        Just like what we did in pushing a new place, here we wait for a pulse that push was successfully done and then we get the key again.
        Specified by:
        pushComment in interface Database
        Parameters:
        comments - This is a Comments object which includes username, photoURL and the comment.
        dbLocation - This is the name of the node in database where we want to push data.
        key - This is the key to the right object to finally push the comments.

      • pushDislike

        public void pushDislike(int dislike,
                        java.lang.String dbLocation,
                        java.lang.String key)
        This method acts just like pushLike() method.
        Specified by:
        pushDislike in interface Database
        Parameters:
        dislike - The number of dislikes that will be updated.
        dbLocation - This is the name of the node in database where we want to push data.
        key - This is the key to the right object to finally push the number of dislikes.

      • pushLike

        public void pushLike(int like,
                     java.lang.String dbLocation,
                     java.lang.String key)
        Unlike pushing a comment or a new place, here we don't listen for any response. We just update the UI statically.
        Specified by:
        pushLike in interface Database
        Parameters:
        like - The number of likes that will be updated.
        dbLocation - This is the name of the node in database where we want to push data.
        key - This is the key to the right object to finally push the number of likes.

      • pushNewPlace

        public void pushNewPlace(NewPlace newPlace,
                         java.lang.String dbLocation)
        Firebase database helps to push an object and when it's done we pass its key to our listener to use it in the future.
        Specified by:
        pushNewPlace in interface Database
        Parameters:
        newPlace - This is a NewPlace object which it includes some data like title, description and ... .
        dbLocation - This is the name of the node in database where we want to push data.

      • query

        public void query(java.lang.String dbLocation,
                  java.lang.String key)
        First it executes a query using the dbLocation and the key. Then it listens for response. By arriving a snapshot first it checks whether it's a query on places or comments and for each scenario it delivers the response to our listeners and they will be used it in the future to populate a list.
        Specified by:
        query in interface Database
        Parameters:
        dbLocation - This is the name of the node in database where we want to execute a query
        key - This is the key to the right object to finally execute that query.
